content: 2 with white make an adjustable loop round 1 6 single_crochet in loop round 2 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet around - 12 scs round 3 *2 single_crochet in next single_crochet 1 single_crochet in next single_crochet repeat from * around - 18 scs fasten_off leaving a long tail to sew wings to body ©heliinä swerdlyk www heliina com assembling stuff the body push the nylon stocking into the body so that the opening is matched up with the opening of the body fill with the pvc pellets or plastic beads this gives it a bit of weight in the body so it doesn t keep falling over due to his or her big head and the nylon stocking keeps the pellets or beads from falling out through any holes in the crochet knot the nylon and cut off any excess stuff any empty spots of the body with polyfill stuffing sew head to body sew wings to body cut the yellow pipe cleaner in 2 pieces and shape antennae according to photo cut other end to desired length and poke into his or her little head add some dabs of glue to hold them in place cut the black pipe cleaner to the desired length of your stinger attach it to bee with a little dab of glue you are finished and ready to play pattern information the contents of this pattern and the crocheted design within are subject to copyright you may use this pattern for personal and non-commercial purposes without express permission from the designer and copyright holder heliinä swerdlyk you may not distribute or sell electronic or paper copies of this pattern and though you may not sell any items produced using the directions or photographs in this pattern you are warmly encouraged to use this pattern for charitable purposes help is free and always available if you have any questions or comments about this pattern please email support@heliina com ©heliinä swerdlyk www heliina com
